intro: Gerbera spathulata, commonly known as the African gerbera, is a herbaceous perennial native to South Africa. It is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers with bright, colorful petals and a central disc. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with sturdy, upright stems and broad, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers bloom in summer and are often used in floral arrangements due to their vibrant colors. Gerbera spathulata thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for gardeners.
